Package org.neo4j.kernel.availability

Class DatabaseAvailabilityGuard

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.lifecycle.LifecycleAdapter
      • org.neo4j.kernel.availability.DatabaseAvailabilityGuard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AvailabilityGuard, Lifecycle
    public class DatabaseAvailabilityGuard
extends LifecycleAdapter
implements AvailabilityGuard
    Single database availability guard.

      • startupFailure

        public void startupFailure​(Throwable cause)
        If a database fails to start the exception can only be found in the debug log, which is very inconvenience in most, if not all cases. This method allows database startup failure to tell this availability guard about that cause so that it can pass it to the DatabaseShutdownException thrown from e.g. assertDatabaseAvailable().
        Parameters:
        cause - cause of failure to start database.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shutdown the guard. After this method is invoked, the database will always be considered unavailable.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Lifecycle
        Overrides:
        shutdown in class LifecycleAdapter

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable()
        Description copied from interface: AvailabilityGuard
        Check if the database is available for transactions to use.
        Specified by:
        isAvailable in interface AvailabilityGuard
        Returns:
        true if there are no requirements waiting to be fulfilled and the guard has not been shutdown
